title: The Human Centipede III (Final Sequence)
summary: Prison warden Bill Boss (Dieter Laser), leading a big state prison in the US of A, has a lot of problems; his prison statistically has the highest amount of prison riots, medical costs and staff turnover in the country. But foremost he is unable to get the respect he thinks he deserves from his inmates and the state Governor (Eric Roberts).Prison warden Bill Boss (Dieter Laser), leading a big state prison in the US of A, has a lot of problems; his prison statistically has the highest amount of prison riots, medical costs and staff turnover in the country. But foremost he is unable to get the respect he thinks he deserves from his inmates and the state Governor (Eric Roberts). He constantly fails in experimenting with different ideas for the ideal punishment to get the inmates in line, which drives him, together with the sizzling heat, completely insane. Under threats of termination by the Governor, his loyal right hand man Dwight (Laurence R Harvey) comes up with a brilliant idea. A revolutionary idea which could change the American prison system for good and save billions of dollars. An idea based on the notorious Human Centipede movies, that will literally and figuratively get the inmates on their knees, creating the ultimate punishment and deterrent for anyone considering a life of crime. Having nothing to lose, Bill and Dwight create a jaw-dropping 500-person prison centipede.… Expand
critic_reviews: Like it or not, Six has contributed something fresh and demented to pop culture.
The Human Centipede III (Final Sequence) is just as repulsive, but far louder, and in color.

Tom Six's threequel races to the bottom with abandon, all while indulging in tired wink-wink self-consciousness that includes Six himself showing up to witness his movie monster made real (and to be slandered by Laser as "a poop-infatuated toddler").
Neither Scary nor eye-rollingly fun, The Human Centipede 3 (Final Sequence) is the dullest entry in an atrocious trilogy.

Bad writing, shoddy effects work, and Laser’s nonstop shouting of every single line of dialogue do not add up to a transgressive statement about the American for-profit prison system, but instead achieve the dubious honor of being the most annoyingly in-your-face horror flick of the year thus far.

Six just wants to shock, though his imagination is so primitive that the effort is strained and a bit pathetic. Initially abrasive, the whole enterprise grows simply tedious well before the now-epically-scaled titular phenom is unveiled in the prison yard.
A cynical, and consistently unpleasant film with creators who try very, very hard to push as many of your buttons as they can.

As horror, it's frightless and boring. As comedy, it's desperate and laughless. As exploitation, it's exceedingly dull. Even excrement was once something of substance. The Human Centipede III: Final Sequence is just rancid air. It too shall pass.
A caldron of unspeakable acts and unpalatable language, The Human Centipede 3 takes the bottom-feeding standards of its previous chapters (released in 2010 and 2011) to new lows of debasement.
Even by the series’ already low standards, The Human Centipede Part 3 is crap.

The gross-out gore scenes and poop jokes are there, too, as is to be expected. The direction is bad, the acting is worse, and it’s lit to mimic the soap-opera effect on a poorly calibrated HDTV. Basically, The Human Centipede III is an unsexy "Ilsa" movie, and it’s just as impossible to sit through as that sounds.
It’s only fitting that a series that began with the concept of linking the digestive tracts of three people would end by feasting on its own shit.
The thing that wrecks The Human Centipede III isn’t how the film is disgustingly, degradingly unclean; instead, Six’s work is ruined by how his film is desperately, depressingly unclever.
Tom Six has achieved the seemingly impossible: He's made a film even less watchable than "The Human Centipede II."

reviews.content: THIS IS ABSOLUTE CRAP. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME. Take the dog for a walk, have a bath, play a game, jump out the window, you will enjoy it more than watching this 0/10

The sheer amount of over the top scenes and outrageous situations make this one of the most humorous films of the decade. This new take on film gives the genre a breath of fresh air as it provokes laughter from the completely intentionalThe sheer amount of over the top scenes and outrageous situations make this one of the most humorous films of the decade. This new take on film gives the genre a breath of fresh air as it provokes laughter from the completely intentional acting styles. Its not about plot or technical prowess, its all about situation and this one is full of it. A much needed burst of energy from the previous two. This films was never made to be taken seriously and it did what it was designed to. The critic reviews were its goal and the sheer enjoyability you get of of this is incredible. Could have used more laughs and a ending which is more climactic but then again, being almost perfect is good enough for this.

A pathetic excuse for a movie. Human Centipede III is poorly written, poorly executed, needlessly vile, shameless, pointless, illogical, annoying, and boring. The previous two movies set the bar pretty low, but somehow this movie managed toA pathetic excuse for a movie. Human Centipede III is poorly written, poorly executed, needlessly vile, shameless, pointless, illogical, annoying, and boring. The previous two movies set the bar pretty low, but somehow this movie managed to be even worse. It seems as if the director is desperate to make the most disgusting movie ever. On some level he succeeded, but it's not really disgusting in the way that makes some horror movies enjoyable. It's just dumb, and pathetic, and laughably bad. Also, the prison warden's unintelligible antics are especially grating. Spare yourself 102 minutes and go watch something else, anything else.

If you can get past Dieter Laser's over the top performance, and the films significantly slow pace; not to mention you being a die hard human centipede fan, your bound to have a blast---or die laughing trying.

I do not go into the Human Centipede films with any expectation of greatness - I watch them out of curiosity, I watch them because after every instalment, Tom Six promises that the next entry will be even more offensive than the last.  And II do not go into the Human Centipede films with any expectation of greatness - I watch them out of curiosity, I watch them because after every instalment, Tom Six promises that the next entry will be even more offensive than the last.  And I admit it, I'm intrigued, and so I allow myself to experience them.  After the last film, one of the most revolting pieces of cinema I've ever seen, Six stated that the sequel would make the former look like a Disney movie (or some similar analogy).  Taking that in mind, I went into The Human Centipede with the expectation that I would want to turn it off halfway through.  And that's exactly what happened, though not for the reasons I imagined.  I was bored.  Horrendously, horribly bored.  This franchise, though not exquisite film making, has at least managed to keep my attention in the past.  But throughout this sequel, I was always unsure at what exactly the film was trying to be.  Was it a comedy?  It seemed to want to be, but Dieter Laser screaming all of his lines in what I perceived to be an attempt at an American accent only made for a one-joke pony, and that joke became stale pretty damn quickly.  Indeed, the style in which Laser delivers his lines renders the film almost unwatchable.  So, not a comedy then.  A horror film?  On paper, it is body horror, but the "centipede" of the title doesn't appear until around fifteen minutes before the end of the film, and despite being 500 people long, is nowhere near as disturbing as the DIY-attempt by Laurence R. Harvey (who also appears here as Laser's assistant) in the previous film.  The lighting throughout the film diminishes it of any creepy atmosphere; unlike its predecessor, The Human Centipede 3 isn't in black and white, and almost, if not all of the scenes are set in the day time in a desert environment.  So not a horror film, then.  An exploitation film?  Of the genres I've mentioned, exploitation certainly comes closest.  But as I mentioned at the beginning of my review, this is some of the most boring exploitation I've ever seen.  Sure the only female in the entire movie is used by a sex object by the antagonist, sure there's a scene in which a prisoner is waterboarded with boiling water, sure there's a scene in which a man is graphically and violently castrated on screen, but in terms of making the last movie look like a Disney film?  Absolutely not; the lacklustre presentation of the titular centipede alone is enough to know that The Human Centipede 3 is nowhere near as gory and gratuitously brutal as its predecessor.  This series was never going to be a magnum opus, (at least, not according to anyone other than Tom Six), but it's a... shame? that it has to end with an entry so dull and deflated.

The Human Centipede III (Full Sequence) is like blue cheese; some people find it disgusting, others unhealthy and a minimal bit of the world enjoy eating. Just spread it around, you might end up loving it.

As I said before my curiosity is my true enemy. The story in this third entry of the Human Centipede series, with returning stars Dieter Laser and Laurence R. Harvey banding together as a new villainous duo aspiring to connect over 500As I said before my curiosity is my true enemy. The story in this third entry of the Human Centipede series, with returning stars Dieter Laser and Laurence R. Harvey banding together as a new villainous duo aspiring to connect over 500 human bodies together. Do any of you remember my review of The Human Centipede 2 where I said I'm not going to watch the other one just because I was that grossed out and angry at the time, and I also didn't know they were making a third movie at the time of that review. I just found out a couple of days about this movie and how it was the final which I had the thought of "Oh god I'm going to watch no matter what I'm I", and I sure did. I know some of you are thinking "Matt why on earth would you watch this movie since you hated the last two movies and what are expecting from this disgusting film series". I know I should know better and I originally had no plans on seeing this one since I still think the second movie is the worst horror movie ever made, but since I already seen and review the first and second movie I thought to myself "Why not finish this horrible franchise of torture porn". These no surprise this movie sucked big time but what really surprise me is how boring the movie is. I hate the fact that this movie is self aware of the others movies as the character's watch and talk about them and how they look like them even when it's the same actor. The other thing that really grinds my gears while watching this movie is how the character's treat the movie director Tom Six (Yes he's in this movie playing himself) like a god to film making, even when  he's not and he's just another Eli Roth clone. Dieter Laser makes a return in this movie and his acting in this movie is so over the top crewing up the scenery that it got to the point that it annoyed the crap out. His character in the movie is so annoying I mean oh my god although the movie he never stops yelling and he was being a total tool to everyone around him. I mean every scene this guy is on he's always screaming, knocking things over and yelling on the top of his lungs and it really got on my nerves to the point were I turned down the volume just to enjoy the silence. The whole movie is deep inside and out ugly just ugliness. Everybody in this movie is awful human being and how this movie treats women is unspeakably awful. Now Human Centipede 3 isn't as horrid or disgusting as the second movie I mean I almost throw up watching that movie. Yeah you get your graphic and gory violence in this one, but this time I didn't feel the need to throw up and take a shower every minute like the second made me do. Overall The Human Centipede 3 is a dull mindless Peace of sh*t gory feast that only sick in the head people would find enjoyment.

dumb, stupid and in general embarassing movie.this makes mankind look very, very bad.Some day in the future, aliens will visit our planet and see this movie. What will they think?This is embarassing and sick

This movie needs rating up! So many non-horror fans down rate every horror film so when you either avoid watching them or watch them anyway to discover a real gem! Part 3 of Human Centipede is a brilliant end to the trilogy. I don't thinkThis movie needs rating up! So many non-horror fans down rate every horror film so when you either avoid watching them or watch them anyway to discover a real gem! Part 3 of Human Centipede is a brilliant end to the trilogy. I don't think the standard, generic, avengers fan, movie goers understand the dark humor and brilliance of the over the top acting and violence in Tom Six's brilliant horror trilogy. People seem to be so sensitive when it comes to stitching people ass to mouth these days! LOL. 3 is set in a prison and barely focuses on the giant centepide built at the end, instead it is a journy into hell created by the insane warden. Who thrives on sadistic torture, eating mutilated female genitals and getting sucked off from his secretary. This is part 1 and 2 on acid. A self aware trip through the insane asylum that is Tom Six's brilliant horror mind. No the director is not a sicko or evil, he is someone who makes great horror for real fans of the genre, not the fakes who say they like a few popular horror movies to look cool, but the real gritty guys who love and know everything about the genre and just love a good scare, or gratuitous scene of over-the-top violence. Brilliant movie as are part one and two.

To save myself some time from reviewing the first two so-called "films"...here are my summaries before getting to this one. 'The Human Centipede (First Sequence)' (2010) (Rating: 0/10) Original, but sick and demented, while Dieter LaserTo save myself some time from reviewing the first two so-called "films"...here are my summaries before getting to this one. 'The Human Centipede (First Sequence)' (2010) (Rating: 0/10) Original, but sick and demented, while Dieter Laser may seem inspired to play a villain, what was supposed to be scary and disturbing turned out to be unintentionally funny and disgusting. Three humans stitched together and being treated like some kind of dog just seems like an idea for a comedy. 'The Human Centipede 2 (Full Sequence)' (2011) (Rating 0/10) A film so messed up and revolting, that it couldn't get passed the BBFC (British Board of Film Classification) until 32 scenes were cut. But even then, it's still shockingly bad in terms of its story which involves an obsessed torture-porn fan kidnapping several people and stapling them together and attempting to even rape the centipede. How Tom Six (writer and director) didn't go to jail for even thinking like this is beyond me. Now we get to this, the most anticipated sequel which gets yet ANOTHER rare zero out of ten rating. Dieter Laser is loud and annoying, even more annoying than Jar Jar Binks of "Star Wars" or Mudflap and Skids from 'Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen' (2009). His constant screaming makes you want to rip out your ears and twist your brain with a drill. If I had to pick several words on how to describe this, what people call a "film", it would be; disgusting, vile, ugly, offensive, degrading, shocking, annoying, obnoxious, ill-hearted, cynical, horrific, time-wasting, sloppy, bastardizing, freaky, damning, hate-filled...and just more you might find in a negative dictionary. Plus, what on earth was Eric Roberts doing in this movie?

I saw the first one twice. I began watching the second one before switching it off half-way through, then building up the courage to finish it a few days later. I managed this stupid bungle of a film in one sitting. I got what I probablyI saw the first one twice. I began watching the second one before switching it off half-way through, then building up the courage to finish it a few days later. I managed this stupid bungle of a film in one sitting. I got what I probably deserved - copious amounts of gore, an unfathomable story and some terrible, terrible acting.I was somewhat impressed with Dieter Laser's performance in the original film, but he is easily the most exasperating aspect of this one - he seems to have confused shouting and bawling at the top of his lungs with acting. What seems really saddest of all though is that he, his co-stars and director Tom Six - who makes the most self-aggrandising cameo in cinema history - seem to genuinely believe that they are making a seriously important work of art. In actual fact, Final Sequence is one of the most grotesque works of alleged art in recent memory.

The only true horror I experience from your hands is the thought of you producing another piece of celluloid. What a sad thought that you may yet have that opportunity to perish the people because of your lack of genius and vision. This movie and series needs to be deep-sixed like your careers in cinema, absolute rubbish not worthy to be spoken of again.

I think this is the first time I write a review about a movie that I have not been able to watch until the end. I firmly believe, after seeing this film, that Tom Six should have some serious mental problem, and I am very sorry because I haveI think this is the first time I write a review about a movie that I have not been able to watch until the end. I firmly believe, after seeing this film, that Tom Six should have some serious mental problem, and I am very sorry because I have never had anything against him personally. I sincerely hope that he will stop working at the movies and be very happy in any other profession.If "Human Centipede" and the sequel that was inexplicably made afterwards were very bad movies, this movie set the record. Again, there is no real script here but a context and a cause. The context is the prison world and the cause is the madness and insanity of the guards and prison director who decide to build the "centipede" with hundreds of prisoners whom they think should be punished more severely. The mistakes continue, that "medically accurate" crap is no longer convincing and is clearly being used with sarcasm and the characters are deeply void.Repeating what I wrote for the second movie, I've never been a fan of gore movies, despite being an admirer of horror movies. Blood and fluids do not scare me, and I honestly do not feel like watching a movie if I suspect it's going to make me throw up my lunch. If I tried watching this movie it was just to be aware of the extent of the crap I already knew he had. I really hope it's the end of the centipedes.

Granted, this did prove to the court that I am not a responsible parent of a four and seven year old, and my nowI thought I was seeing Paw Patrol with my kids but when I saw the anal centipede, I knew I was in for a much more exciting movie! Granted, this did prove to the court that I am not a responsible parent of a four and seven year old, and my now ex wife has a restraining order against me, but it was more than worth it for the extremely exciting film known as THE HUMAN CENTIPEDE III (FINAL SEQUENCE). Not quite as good as Morbius tho.

Coming from someone who is a big fan of the first two films, this one is a let down. Overall it isn't extremely gory and it takes a more comedic approach (which I am not such if it is the purpose because I personally don't find the humor funny). This series gets more meta as it evolves, and in this last film it's a bit too over the top for me, it almost comes of as an ego stroke. It is not the worst garbage in the world but it is not worth your time.

The second part already spoiled the magic of the first a bit by the fact that it was only a film and it was not real, but here it deepened even more. Two had a great idea. Martin from the second, who is suddenly Dwight here. I do not understand. I absolutely don't understand why this film was made. Previous films have at least tried to be more disgusting and disgusting. Here, what was probably the most disgusting was cutting the balls. I apologize for the smaller spoiler of what awaits you, but in my opinion it will not come out better in the film. At least the two were disgusting and I enjoyed it. I wanted to see another real perversion, but I didn't get anything more than just **** that ruined the whole series, and the two just had to end. In my opinion, this should never have happened. For me, a bad film that I do not recommend, not even to someone who is looking for a real filthy, because he will not see it here.
